title: Animal Farm
description: A farm where the animals rebel against their human owner, hoping to create a society where all animals are equal. But power corrupts, and some animals become more equal than others.

chapters.title: Old Major's Dream
chapters.content:
Old Major, a prize-winning boar, calls a meeting of all the animals on Manor Farm. He tells them about a dream he had, where all animals lived together without human tyranny. He teaches them a song called 'Beasts of England' which describes his utopian vision. Old Major explains that Man is the only real enemy. chapters.title: The Rebellion
chapters.content:
Three months after Old Major's death, the animals successfully rebel against Mr. Jones, the farm owner. The pigs, who are the most intelligent, take the lead. They paint over the sign 'Manor Farm' and replace it with 'Animal Farm'. They establish the Seven Commandments of Animalism, which are written on the barn wall. chapters.title: The Windmill
chapters.content:
Snowball proposes building a windmill to generate electricity for the farm. Napoleon opposes the idea. The animals debate the issue, and Snowball makes an eloquent speech in favor of the windmill. Just as the animals are about to vote in favor of Snowball's plan, Napoleon gives a strange whimper, and nine enormous dogs burst into the barn. They chase Snowball off the farm. chapters.title: The Commandments Change
chapters.content:
Over time, the pigs begin to break the Seven Commandments, but Squealer, Napoleon's spokesperson, always finds a way to explain their actions. The pigs move into the farmhouse and sleep in beds, which violates the commandment 'No animal shall sleep in a bed.' But Squealer changes the commandment to 'No animal shall sleep in a bed with sheets.' The pigs also begin to drink alcohol, which violates 'No animal shall drink alcohol.' chapters.title: The Pigs Become Men
chapters.content:
Years pass, and the farm becomes more prosperous, but only the pigs and dogs benefit. The other animals work harder than ever, but they receive less food. The pigs begin to walk on two legs and carry whips. They wear clothes and smoke pipes. One day, the animals look through the farmhouse window and see the pigs playing cards with human farmers.
